body:
Using this BiqQuery table https://bigquery.cloud.google.com/table/fh-bigquery:github_extracts.contents_go provide by @campoy, I tried a simple "starts with alias" query.

```sql
SELECT line, count(*) as n
FROM (
 SELECT SPLIT(content, '\n') as line
 FROM [fh-bigquery:github_extracts.contents_go]
 HAVING LEFT(line, 6) = 'alias '
)
GROUP BY line
ORDER BY n DESC
LIMIT 10
```

```
row | line                          | n
----|-------------------------------|--
1   | alias = "spf13"               | 8
2   | alias iga='hf -cmd="git add"'	| 1
3   | alias dazing holomorphy #69	| 1
```

### UPDATE: here's a better query with 7016 matches for `alias`

(there are some false positives)

```sql
SELECT 'https://github.com/' + sample_repo_name + '/blob/master/' + sample_path as url, line 
FROM (
  -- remove "quoted text" including \" escapes
  SELECT *, REGEXP_REPLACE(REGEXP_REPLACE(nocomment, r'\\"', ''), r'".*?"', '') nostrings
  FROM (
    -- remove to the end of the line for // comments
    SELECT *, REGEXP_REPLACE(line, r'\s*//.*', '') nocomment
    FROM (
      -- remove /* multi-line comments */ and split lines
      SELECT sample_repo_name, sample_path, SPLIT(REGEXP_REPLACE(content, r'/\*.*?\*/', ''), '\n') as line
      FROM [fh-bigquery:github_extracts.contents_go]
      WHERE content CONTAINS 'alias'
    )
   )
  -- alias followed by a non-word character
  HAVING REGEXP_MATCH(nostrings, r'.*alias\W')
)
```

Results: [Google Sheets](https://docs.google.com/a/nathany.com/spreadsheets/d/1GIOE847M_YJBCmiiamdHqHGW1ym1Q-ASNT2YJlXlFeE/edit?usp=sharing)

Go 2.0 ðŸŽ‰ 

Changing that last REGEXP to `HAVING REGEXP_MATCH(nostrings, r'\Walias\W')` returns 6618 results. It removes false positives but I think it is missing some cases where alias is at the very beginning or very end.
